analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni chen po ste 'jig rten thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // thugs rje dam pa des spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po skyes pa'i rgyu des 'jig rten la thugs brtse zhing theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rin po che dam pa bstan
translated: The word great means highest, because it takes the whole world as its object.

analyzed: yang na sems can re re'i phyir bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: blo gros zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /

original: mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang la thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros yod pa de ni thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gang la thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros yod pa de ni thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros mnga' ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag @11a * //

analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni mi rigs pas 'tsho ba ste /

analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni cho ga mi shes pa ste /

analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la spyod pas kyang /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag dang ldan na sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po skye'o ;

analyzed: / de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po la gnas pa zhes bya ste /

original: de ltar thugs rje dam pas spro ba rab tu bskyed pa'i blo gros mnga' ba 'jig rten la thugs brtse zhing theg pa mchog gis 'gro ba rnams la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rin po che dam pa bstan par dgongs pa na /

analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis so //

translated: It is endowed with the discernment and analysis of the power of courage and the power of mind.

original: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa /
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa /
translated: It is in accord with self-arisen wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par chol ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par chol ba /

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is endowed with the dharmadhatu.

original: nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa las sems de skye bar 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ltar gnas shing phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa las sems de skye bar 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is like the element of space. It arises from the mind that abides until the end of time.

original: ji 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ni sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' byis pa so so skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa yin /
analyzed: ji 'dra ba'i sems de skye bar 'gyur ba de ni sems skye ba de skyes ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' byis pa so so skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa yin /
translated: The moment that such a mind arises, the bodhisattva has transcended the stage of the foolish, ordinary beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin /
translated: He has entered into the faultlessness of a Bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: He has been born into the family of the Tathagatas.

original: man ngag brjod pas kha na ma tho ba med pa yin /
analyzed: man ngag brjod pas kha na ma tho ba med pa yin /
translated: He is without fault in his instructions.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa yin /
translated: He has turned away from all worldly paths.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa yin /
translated: He has entered the supramundane path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin /
translated: He abides in the reality of a Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas la rab tu gnas pa yin /
translated: He is well established in the station of a Bodhisattva.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin /
translated: He has realized the equality of the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin te /
translated: He is certain in the family of the Tathagatas and is directed towards complete enlightenment.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag chos 'di lta bu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //

translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, the Bodhisattva who abides in such qualities as these abides in the Bodhisattva ground The Joyful, by way of being unmoving.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas chos de lta bu la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis rab tu gnas par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i @23b tshig gis rabüîΩtu bstan pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas chos de lta bu la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis rab tu gnas par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i @23b tshig gis rab tu bstan pa /
translated: the TathƒÅgata's way of teaching with words such as non-arising, etc.

analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid thugs su chud nas zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Having realized unerring suchness indicates

analyzed: de ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis rgyu bstan pa yin no / // / bam po gsum pa /
translated: the master's statement of the cause.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Thus, the master's statement

original: sngon mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: sngon mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa na /
translated: While previously dwelling on the stage of practice through belief,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa 'thob pa'i rgyu de lta bu thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i sa 'thob pa'i rgyu de lta bu thugs su chud pas /
translated: having realized such a cause for attaining the stage of pure superior intention,

original: 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid ci zhig brnyes she na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid ci zhig brnyes she na /
translated: what result characterized by one's own aim did he attain?

original: de'i phyir dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /
translated: Therefore, with the power of intense joy perfectly generated, he praises the Bhagavat in the manner of what he has understood.

original: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Having done so, he wishes to compose the treatise.

original: de la dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid brnyes pa dngos bstan la /
analyzed: de la dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid brnyes pa dngos bstan la /
translated: There, the power of intense joy perfectly generated indicates the attainment of the result, which is the nature of one's own aim.

original: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod par mdzad
analyzed: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod par mdzad
translated: Praising the Bhagavat in the manner of what he has understood indicates that, in order to ripen his own Buddha qualities, he praises the Bhagavat in the manner of what he has understood.

original: nas / 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid de brnyes pa bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: nas / 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid de brnyes pa bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: Having done so, he specifically teaches the attainment of the result, which is the nature of one's own aim.

original: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pas /
translated: Having resolved to compose the treatise means that, in order to bring about the full evolution of external sentient beings, he resolved to compose the treatise.

original: 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid de brnyes pa bye brag tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid de brnyes pa bye brag tu bstan to //
translated: The attainment of the result, which is characterized by one's own aim, is specifically indicated.

original: de la dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having generated the power of intense joy in that means that he attained the first bodhisattva stage called Joyful.

original: de la dgyes pa'i shugs zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba mang bas rab tu dga' ba dang / dmigs pas rab tu dga' ba'i shugs so //
analyzed: de la dgyes pa'i shugs zhes bya ba ni mchog tu dga' ba mang bas rab tu dga' ba dang / dmigs pas rab tu dga' ba'i shugs so //
translated: The power of intense joy in that means that he was joyful because of his abundant supreme joy, and that he was joyful because of the power of his objective.

original: drag po zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: drag po zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
translated: Intense means great.

original: yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni phyis kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par skyes pas zhes bya ba ni phyis kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba skyes pa'o //
translated: Having generated means that he generated it in such a way that he would not be separated from it later.

original: de ltar na slob dpon gang la byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes pas dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par brnyes pa mnga' ba de ni dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pa ste des so //
analyzed: de ltar na slob dpon gang la byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes pas dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par brnyes pa mnga' ba de ni dgyes pa'i shugs drag po yang dag par skyes pa ste des so //
translated: Thus, the master who has attained the first bodhisattva stage, Very Joyful, has attained the power of intense joy.

analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i mdo las /

original: dga' ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba ni /

analyzed: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi ston par gyur to //

analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ba dang ; nye bar gyur to //

translated: ‚Äù This is to be supplied with the words, ‚Äúintending to compose the treatise in order to bring about the full maturation of sentient beings who are external to the Buddhist path.

translated: ‚ÄúIntending to compose‚Äù means intending to undertake the activity of composing.

analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed par ci'i phyir dang por bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he praise the Lord at the beginning, intending to compose the treatise?

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pa na /
translated: Thus, when he wishes to compose the treatise in order to bring about the full maturation of sentient beings,

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang por lha yid du 'ong ba la mngon par bstod cing phyag 'tshal na /
translated: he first praises and pays homage to the delightful deities in order to bring about the full maturation of his own qualities of a buddha.

original: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi cho yongs su smin pas brtsams pa de 'grub cing phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi cho yongs su smin pas brtsams pa de 'grub cing phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since his own qualities of a buddha are fully matured, he accomplishes what he has undertaken and brings about the full maturation of sentient beings.

analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes shing /
translated: Thus, the master having attained the first bodhisattva stage, the Joyous,

original: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya @25a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya @25a * //

analyzed: de ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin no //

original: de ltar 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes shing /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu rang gi don gyi mtshan nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po rab tu dga' ba brnyes shing /
translated: Having thus attained the first Bodhisattva stage, the Joyous, which is the definition of the result as one's own aim,

original: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang ldan par gyur nas /

analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid ci zhig mdzad ce na /
translated: what does he do that is the definition of the result as the aim of others?üîΩTherefore, he says,

original: de'i phyir thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas skye bo rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin cing khong du chud par 'dod pas rtogs par bzhed nas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas skye bo rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin cing khong du chud par 'dod pas rtogs par bzhed nas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because his mind is moistened by the water of compassion, he is desirous of realizing the welfare of beings, and he is desirous of their understanding, he is desirous of their realization.

translated: Since he has a mind moistened by the water of compassion indicates the reason for composing the treatise, the characteristic of the result, which is the benefit of others.üîΩSince he is desirous of causing those who are primarily devoted to inference to understand, indicates the object for whom the treatise is composed, the characteristic of the result, which is the benefit of others.

original: rtogs par bzhed nas zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu gzhan gyi don gyi mtshan nyid bstan bcos mdzad pa dngos bstan to //

translated: Since he is desirous of causing them to understand, indicates the actual composition of the treatise, the characteristic of the result, which is the benefit of others.

original: de la ci'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad ce na /
translated: Why was the treatise composed?

original: de'i phyir thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, since he has a mind moistened by the water of compassion.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas thugs rje nyid kyi chus brlan pa'i thugs mnga' bas skye bo rjes su dpag pa gtsor 'dzin cing khong du chud par 'dod pas rtogs par bzhed nas bstan bcos mdzad kyi /

analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems kyis rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: // 'di la gang zag bzhi yod de /

original: byed pa po med par yang gzhi med pa'i bya ba mi rung ste med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don byed pa po yod par sgrub pa de ma grub pas des bsgrubs pa'i phyogs nyams par ston toüîΩ// byed pa po yod pa dang med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni 'di la brda sprod pa po'i lung las rang dbang ni byed pa @34a * //
analyzed: byed pa po med par yang gzhi med pa'i bya ba mi rung ste med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu 'gro ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don byed pa po yod par sgrub pa de ma grub pas des bsgrubs pa'i phyogs nyams par ston to // byed pa po yod pa dang med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni 'di la brda sprod pa po'i lung las rang dbang ni byed pa @34a * //
translated: Since that proof of the existence of the agent is not established, it demonstrates that the position that it proves is flawed.

original: po'i zhes 'byung bas khyod ni byed pa po yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: po'i zhes 'byung bas khyod ni byed pa po yod par 'dod la /
translated: With respect to ‚Äúalso in the position that the agent exists and does not exist,‚Äù since the statement of the grammarians says ‚Äúindependence is the agent,‚Äù you assert that the agent exists.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung las ni byed pa po med par 'dod pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung las ni byed pa po med par 'dod pas /
translated: But in the scriptures of the Buddhists, the agent is asserted to be nonexistent.

original: byed pa po yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs de gnyis la yang ngo //
analyzed: byed pa po yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs de gnyis la yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, with respect to those two positions, that the agent exists and does not exist,

original: ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa las 'byung ba'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa la ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /üîΩkhyod la byed pa po yod pa yang nged la ma grags la /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa las 'byung ba'i phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa la ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te / khyod la byed pa po yod pa yang nged la ma grags la /
translated: The meaning of the reason would not be established for the opponent, because the fault stated earlier would ensue.üîΩFor you, an existent agent is not renowned to us,

original: nged la byed pa po med pa de yang khyod la ma grags pas na /
analyzed: nged la byed pa po med pa de yang khyod la ma grags pas na /
translated: and for us, a nonexistent agent is not renowned to you.

original: gang yang rung ba la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason would not be established for either of you.

original: ji skad du phyogs kyi chos ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba la nges pa gang yin pa de gzung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du phyogs kyi chos ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba la nges pa gang yin pa de gzung ngo zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe property of the position is that which is ascertained for both the proponent and the opponent.‚Äù

original: 'on te brda sprod pa pas gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa ma grub pa'i skyon de yang spang ba'i phyir byed pa po med pa nyid du 'dod na ni des na khyod kyis sngar byed pa po yod par grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo zhes smras pas /üîΩrang gis khas blangs pa de la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te brda sprod pa pas gtan tshigs kyi don yod pa ma grub pa'i skyon de yang spang ba'i phyir byed pa po med pa nyid du 'dod na ni des na khyod kyis sngar byed pa po yod par grub pa'i mtha' las 'byung ngo zhes smras pas / rang gis khas blangs pa de la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that the person does not exist as an agent in order to avoid the fault of the reason‚Äôs meaning being unestablished, then you would be contradicting your own assertion that the person exists as an agent, as stated in your tenets.

original: 'on te ngo tsha bor nas bdag la byed pa po yod par grub kyang gzhan la byed pa po med par grags pas /
analyzed: 'on te ngo tsha bor nas bdag la byed pa po yod par grub kyang gzhan la byed pa po med par grags pas /
translated: If you abandon shame and say, ‚ÄúAlthough the person exists as an agent for us, for others the person does not exist as an agent.

original: bdag gis kyang gzhan gyi gzhung bsgrub dgos pas byed pa po med par smra ste /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang gzhan gyi gzhung bsgrub dgos pas byed pa po med par smra ste /
translated: Since we must prove the treatises of others, we say that the person does not exist as an agent.

original: des na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore the reason‚Äôs meaning of existence is not unestablished,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhan la grags pa'i gtan tshigs brjod na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la grags pa'i gtan tshigs brjod na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúif you state a reason that is renowned to others, it is a fallacy.‚Äù

original: ji skad bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la byed pa po yod pa nyid du grub kyang sangs rgyas dag gi gzhung las byed pa po med pa nyid du grags pas de'i phyir bdag kyang byed pa po med pa nyid du khas len to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la byed pa po yod pa nyid du grub kyang sangs rgyas dag gi gzhung las byed pa po med pa nyid du grags pas de'i phyir bdag kyang byed pa po med pa nyid du khas len to zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that the agent exists in your own tenets, but that the Buddha‚Äôs scriptures declare that the agent does not exist, then you should accept that the self is also an agent that does not exist.

original: 'o na ni byed pa po dang / byed pa dang / bya ba dang las dang / gang la sbyin pa dang / 'bral ba dang / gzhi zhes bya ba byed pa po thams cad bsal ba gzhan dag kyang lhur blangs te brda sprod pa pa'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mi mthun pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'o na ni byed pa po dang / byed pa dang / bya ba dang las dang / gang la sbyin pa dang / 'bral ba dang / gzhi zhes bya ba byed pa po thams cad bsal ba gzhan dag kyang lhur blangs te brda sprod pa pa'i grub pa'i mtha' dang mi mthun pa'i chos /
translated: Then you should also accept all the other things that are not accepted in the grammar of the grammarians, such as the agent, action, object, and basis of giving, as well as the giver, the recipient, and the gift.

original: chos bdag med pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa la sogs pa yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: You should also accept such things as the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'on te de dag khas mi len na ni byed pa po med pa nyid du khas len ces bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de dag khas mi len na ni byed pa po med pa nyid du khas len ces bya ba 'di yang brjod par mi bya'o //

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra sun 'byin pa'i grub pa gsal bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra yang grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra sun 'byin pa'i grub pa gsal bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgra yang grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //

original: 'dir @34b gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir @34b gzhan dag na re /
translated: Here, others say:

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyur gyur pa'i las gzhan gyis thob par bya ba yin na 'dir ji ltar las nyid 'bras bur brjod par bya zhes zer bas de'i phyir bstan pa ni las yin te zhes bya ba smras so //

analyzed: de bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi 'bras bu de bstan pa'o //

analyzed: las yin te zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos 'bras bu de bstan pa nyid las yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu de nyid ston pa na las su 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang dper na las kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang dper na las kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThere are three types of action:

analyzed: lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las so zhes ji skad brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: the action of body, the action of speech, and the action of mind.‚Äù

original: de bstan pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bstan pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that teaching?

original: de'i phyir / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúNon-cessation, non-arising,

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: non-annihilation, non-permanence,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //üîΩtha dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa // tha dad don min don gcig min //
translated: non-coming, non-going,

original: zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: not a different object, not a single object.‚Äù

original: tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag ni /
translated: These eight topics

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung chen po las bka' stsal te /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don kyang 'di nyid yin la /

analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang 'di nyid thugs su chud pas de kho na thugs su chud pa yin /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rab tu bstan pa ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyang 'di nyid yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis rab tu bstan pa ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyang 'di nyid yin /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod par brjod par bya ba yang 'di yin no //

original: tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba ji ltar nges par shes she na /
analyzed: tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba ji ltar nges par shes she na /

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutra,

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúO sons of the gods, in this profound perfection of wisdom, there is the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of signlessness, the characteristic of wishlessness, the characteristic of non-application,

analyzed: skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rten pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don @35a * //
translated: the characteristic of non-arising, the characteristic of non-cessation, the characteristic of non-affliction, the characteristic of non-purification, the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of non-dependence,üîΩthe characteristic of non-annihilation, the characteristic of non-permanence, the characteristic of non-identity,

analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /

analyzed: 'di lta ste mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du brdas tha snyad du bstan gyi /

analyzed: tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa mdo sde mtha' yas pa gzhan dag las kyang 'byung ste /

translated: The realization of bodhisattvas is the realization of non-coming, the realization of non-going, the realization of non-arising, the realization of non-ceasing, the realization of non-defilement, the realization of non-purification, the realization of non-production, and the realization of non-duality.

original: chad pa med par rtogs pa dang / rtag pa med par rtogs pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin par rtogs pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin par rtogs pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: chad pa med par rtogs pa dang / rtag pa med par rtogs pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin par rtogs pa dang / don gcig pa ma yin par rtogs pa'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: It is the wheel of non-production, the wheel of non-cessation, the wheel of non-annihilation, the wheel of non-permanence, the wheel of non-differentiation of objects, and the wheel of non-identity of objects.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i le'u las /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i le'u las /
translated: And in the chapter on the wheel of Dharma in the noble extensive sutra of the Play in Full,

original: byams pa de ni skye ba med pa'i 'khor lo dang / 'gag pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / chad pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / rtag pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'khor lo dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa'i 'khor lo dang /
analyzed: byams pa de ni skye ba med pa'i 'khor lo dang / 'gag pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / chad pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / rtag pa med pa'i 'khor lo dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i 'khor lo dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa'i 'khor lo dang /
translated: Maitreya, it is the wheel of non-production, the wheel of non-cessation, the wheel of non-annihilation, the wheel of non-permanence, the wheel of non-differentiation of objects, the wheel of non-identity of objects,üîΩthe wheel of non-coming, and the wheel of non-going.

original: 'ong ba med pa'i 'khor lo dang / 'gro ba med pa'i 'khor lo yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa'i 'khor lo dang / 'gro ba med pa'i 'khor lo yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag la sogs pa mdo sde gzhan dag las kyang tshig gi don brgyad po 'di dag rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: These eight topics occur extensively in other sutras as well.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
translated: Here, others say:

original: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de /

original: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes smra na /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes smra na /

analyzed: bstan bcos ni ma smos pas de'i phyir slob dpon gyis nyes par smras pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs @35b snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan ni /
translated: The response to this prior position that is drawn from within is as follows:

translated: This is the text that states, ‚ÄúSince one does not understand the meaning of the words without understanding the meaning of the words, one does not understand the meaning of the speech, the chapters, and the treatise. Therefore, one should first state the meaning of the words.‚Äù

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lan gyi tshig nye bar dgod pa'i don la'o //

analyzed: tshig gi don rtogs pa med par zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don khong du chud pa med par rab tshig gi don khong du chud pa ma gtogs par ro //

original: ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs shing khong du mi chud pas so //
analyzed: ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs shing khong du mi chud pas so //
translated: Because one does not understand the meaning of speech, composition, and treatises means that without understanding the meaning of the words, one does not understand or comprehend the meaning of speech, composition, and treatises.

original: 'di la tshig bsdus pa ni ngag yin la /üîΩngag bsdus pa ni rab tu byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la tshig bsdus pa ni ngag yin la / ngag bsdus pa ni rab tu byed pa yin /

analyzed: rab tu byed pa bsdus pa ni bstan bcos yin te /

analyzed: de la tshig gi don zhes bya ba ni ming dang bya ba tsam brjod pa ste /

analyzed: 'dir ni 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba dang / skye ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / chad pa med pa zhes bya ba dang / rtag pa med pa zhes bya ba dang / 'ong ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Here, each of the following is called a verbal meaning: ‚Äúnon-cessation,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-arising,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-annihilation,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-eternality,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-coming,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-going,‚Äù

analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / don gcig pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba lta bu dag re re la tshig gi don zhes bya'o //

original: ngag gi don zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi don zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don bsdus pa ste /
translated: The meaning of speech is the collection of verbal meanings.üîΩHere, the following is taught:

analyzed: 'dir ni / gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung // 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //

original: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: Non-annihilated and non-eternal,

original: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa 'gro med pa //
translated: Non-come and non-gone,

original: thad dad don min don gcig min //
analyzed: thad dad don min don gcig min //

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa //üîΩrdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi bstan pa // rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas smra rnams kyi //

original: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dam pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'i tshig gis don mang po bsdus pas don yongs su rdzogs pa cig bstan pa ni ngag gi don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'i tshig gis don mang po bsdus pas don yongs su rdzogs pa cig bstan pa ni ngag gi don zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don bsdus pas skabs kyi don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /

analyzed: 'dir ni rkyen brtag pa la sogs pa rab tu byed pa'i skabs nyi shu rtsa bdun bstan pa dag re re la rab tu byed pa'i don zhes bya'o //

analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i gzhung mtha' dag gi don yongs su rdzogs pa ste /

original: de'i phyir @36a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @36a * //

analyzed: tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang / rab tu byed pa dang / bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs so //

analyzed: de'i phyir dang po kho nar tshig gi don brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos mdzad pa 'ga' la yang lugs mi mthun pa gzhan med de / tshig gi don rtogs pas ngag gi don ston la /

analyzed: ngag gi don rtogs pas rab tu byed pa'i don ston na /

analyzed: tshig dang ngag dang / rab tu byed pa dang / bstan bcos dag ni dus gcig tu cig car gcig tu bsdus te tshig tu gdon du mi rung ba de'i phyir /

analyzed: de bas na slob dpon gyis nyes par smras pa ma yin no //

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: gal te de lta na yang khyod kyi go rims nyams pa yin te /
translated: Even if that is so, your order is impaired.

original: 'di ltar tshig gi don la sogs pa'i mdun du yi ge'i don 'gro bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gi don la sogs pa'i mdun du yi ge'i don 'gro bas /

analyzed: dang po kho nar yi ge'i don bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: it is reasonable that the meaning of the letters should be understood first.üîΩFor example, it is said:üîΩThe atom, the molecule, water, iron, rabbit,

analyzed: rgyang grags dang ni dpag tshad rnams //

analyzed: gzhu lnga brgyal rgyang grags so //

translated: Eight earshots is one k·π£a·πáa.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsgre bas dpag tshad la sogs pa'i lam gyi rtsom pa dag / bdun dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / phyed dang bzhi dang / bzhi dang lnga brgya dang / @36b brgyad 'gyur gyis ci rigs su rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi dang po rtsom pa ni rdul phra rab yin pas de dang por brjod par bya dgos pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa bsgre bas dpag tshad la sogs pa'i lam gyi rtsom pa dag / bdun dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / phyed dang bzhi dang / bzhi dang lnga brgya dang / @36b brgyad 'gyur gyis ci rigs su rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi dang po rtsom pa ni rdul phra rab yin pas de dang por brjod par bya dgos pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: and the composition of paths such as yojanas and so on is established by multiplying the smallest unit, the infinitesimal particle, by seven, twenty-four, one and a half, four, five hundred and eight.

analyzed: 'dir yang bstan bcos dang rab tu 'byed pa dang ngag dang tshig gi don ci rigs su rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyi dang po rtsom pa ni yi ge yin pas ;

analyzed: de'i phyir dang po kho nar yi ge'i don brjod par bya bar rigs na /

analyzed: ma brjod pas go rims nyams pa yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir dbu ma pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra ba kha cig na re /

analyzed: tshig gi phyogs gcig ni lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhe'o //

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag gi don rab tu byed pa'i don gnyis bsdu'o //

original: ngag la sogs pa'i don la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngag la sogs pa'i don la zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: ngag gi don dang rab tu byed pa'i don dang / bstan bcos kyi don la'o //
translated: to the meaning of the speech, the meaning of the treatise, and the meaning of the treatise.

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras kyang rab tu byed pa'i don dang bstan bcos kyi don gnyis bsdu'o//
translated: The word etc. also includes the two meanings of the treatise and the treatise.

original: phan pa byed pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas te /üîΩtshig gi don gyis ni ngag gi don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed la /
analyzed: phan pa byed pa nyid yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas te / tshig gi don gyis ni ngag gi don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed la /
translated: It is helpful because it generates a special understanding.üîΩThe meaning of the words generates a special understanding that clarifies the meaning of the sentences.

original: ngag gi don gyis ni rab tu byed pa'i don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed /
analyzed: ngag gi don gyis ni rab tu byed pa'i don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed /
translated: The meaning of the sentences generates a special understanding that clarifies the meaning of the chapters.

original: rab tu byed pa'i don gyis ni bstan bcos kyi don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i don gyis ni bstan bcos kyi don gsal bar 'gyur ba'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //

analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir tshig gi don rtogs na ngag dang rab tu byed pa dang / bstan bcos kyi don yang rtogs par 'gyur bas /

analyzed: de ni bya ba'i sgo nas rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no //

original: 'di la chos mthun pa'i dpe yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di la chos mthun pa'i dpe yang yod de /

original: dper na rkang pa ni lam du 'gro bar byed pa la phan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na rkang pa ni lam du 'gro bar byed pa la phan pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, the feet are helpful for walking on a path.

analyzed: lam du 'gro ba'i yan lag gi gtso bo nyid yin pa dang 'dra bar tshig gi don kyang ngag la sogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba la phan par byed pa nyid yin te / ngag @37a * //
translated: Just as it is the principal limb of one who goes on a path, so too the meaning of a word is that which benefits the understanding of the meaning of speech and so on.

original: la sogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i yan lag gi gtso bo nyid yin pas 'dir dang por bstan to //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i yan lag gi gtso bo nyid yin pas 'dir dang por bstan to //

original: tshig gi phyogs gcig ni lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dir tshig gi phyogs gcig ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgya gar skad las /
analyzed: tshig gi phyogs gcig ni lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la / 'dir tshig gi phyogs gcig ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgya gar skad las /
translated: One part of a word is like one who goes on a path.

original: pa dee ka de sha zhes bya ba tshig zur gnyis su sbyar ba yin te /üîΩtshig gi phyogs gcig ces kyang bya /
analyzed: pa dee ka de sha zhes bya ba tshig zur gnyis su sbyar ba yin te / tshig gi phyogs gcig ces kyang bya /
translated: Here the term one part of a word is a compound of two terms in Sanskrit.

original: rkang pa'i phyogs gcig ces kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i phyogs gcig ces kyang bya ste /
translated: It is called one part of a word and one part of a foot.

original: tshig gi phyogs gcig ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi phyogs gcig ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: One part of a word does not benefit the meaning of speech and so on.

original: dper na rkang pa'i phyogs gcig lam du 'gro ba la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na rkang pa'i phyogs gcig lam du 'gro ba la phan par byed pa nyid ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: de la tshig gi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni tshig gi don gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshig gi phyogs gcig ces bya ba ni tshig gi don gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ste /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúone part of a word‚Äù is a part of the meaning of a word.

original: tshig gi don rtsom par byed pa'i rgyu yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: tshig gi don rtsom par byed pa'i rgyu yi ge'i don to //
translated: The meaning of a word is the meaning of a letter that is the cause of the composition of a word.

original: tshig gi don gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yi ge'i don de ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan pa byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi don gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa yi ge'i don de ni ngag la sogs pa'i don la phan pa byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of a letter, which is a part of the meaning of a word, does not function to assist in the meaning of speech, etc.

analyzed: de la tshig gi don rtogs pa med par ngag dang / rab tu byed pa dang / bstan bcos kyi don mi rtogs pas de'i phyir dang po kho nar tshig gi don brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di yin no // kha cig na re tshig la sogs pa'i don @39a * //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod de bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed nas zhes smra na /

analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas bstan bcos nyid bya ba yin na /

original: mtho ris gzugs med pa'i khams thob par byed pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: mtho ris gzugs med pa'i khams thob par byed pa'i lam ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The path that causes attainment of the higher realms and the formless realm is the four formless absorptions.

original: byang grol rnam gnyis thob par byed pa'i lam ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: byang grol rnam gnyis thob par byed pa'i lam ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The path that causes the attainment of the two, enlightenment and liberation, is the eightfold noble path, consisting of the characteristics of right view, etc., together with its following.

original: nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
